item.title: Configure Your PTCL SmartLink SIP Account On Freeswitch
item.description: Following up on my previous post on how to configure your PTCL Smart Link SIP account on asterisk, below is the configuration I used for PTCL â€“ Just replace USERNAME and PASSWORD with your credentials. You will also need to change your user agent , This can be done by adding the below parameter in sip_profiles/external.xml

item.title: Freeswitch :: Wateen Update
item.description: Just a quick update , anthm @ freeswitch.org has fixed the bug in freeswitch that was preventing the switch to register with Wateenâ€™s gateway. So , go , grab the latest freeswitch code from svn and compile. Here are the settings for your sip_profile _ðŸ™‚ Have fun! and drop a comment if this post was helpful.

item.title: Freeswitch :: Register-proxy Bug
item.description: While trying to configure wateen sip on my freeswitch install , i encountered a bug , aparently wateen has a broken implementation , they dont have srv records for their domain wateen.net, but their sip server / ims envoirnment seems to be forcing it , in the sip â€“ uri. Hereâ€™s exactly whats broken Working â€“ Eyebeam REGISTER sip:wateen.net SIP/2.0 To: Wateen Usersip:[021xxxxx@wateen.net][1] From: Wateen Usersip:[021xxxxx@wateen.net][1];tag=90298206 Via: SIP/2.0/UDP 192.168.1.51:6473;branch=z9hG4bK-d87543-704653288-1â€“d87543-;rport Call-ID: 3736784a1d468701

item.title: Mobilink Infinity :: Freeswitch :: One Way Audio
item.description: If you are facing one way audio issue with freeswitch for all outgoing calls via mobilink infinity trunk , all you need to do is to edit conf/vars.xml and set EXT_SIP_IP & EXT_RTP_IP to 192.168.100.1 . Thatâ€™s it , your one way audio issue will be resolved ðŸ™‚ .

item.title: Howto configure Mobilink Infinity VoIP on Freeswitch
item.description:
You can configure your mobilink infinity VoIP number on Freeswitch aswell , Freeswitch is a very nice alternative to Asterisk with a SIP stack that actually works! BKW @ #freeswitch on irc.freenode.net helped me with this ðŸ™‚ Here is the conf/sip_profiles/external/mobilink.xml settings _Hereâ€™s the dialplan entry conf/dialplan/extensions/000_myext.xml
Oh by the way , for this, make sure the SIP ALG on your outdoor cpe is turned on , while the indoor one needs to be off ðŸ™‚
